intro: Gardoquia pilosa, commonly known as the hairy gardoquia, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant is notable for its dense, hairy foliage, which gives it its common name and helps in reducing water loss in arid environments. It produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in clusters, attracting various pollinators. Gardoquia pilosa is often found in rocky or dry habitats, showcasing its adaptability to challenging ecological conditions.
